value.title: Secure your Azure SQL Database
value.excerpt: Secure an Azure SQL database to keep the information safe and diagnose potential security concerns as they happen.

value.title: Set up an IoT Edge Gateway
value.excerpt: This module is theoretical and will walk you through how an IoT Edge device can be used as a gateway.

value.title: Spark architecture fundamentals
value.excerpt: Spark architecture fundamentals

value.title: Store and access graph data in Azure Cosmos DB with the Graph API
value.excerpt: Find out about creating an application with Azure Cosmos DB as a graph database, then retrieve, manipulate, and visualize graph data using Data Explorer.

value.title: Secure your infrastructure with threat modeling
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the foundation of threat modeling to identify enterprise risks and find ways to reduce or eliminate them.

value.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
value.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and context.

value.title: Train a machine learning model with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to train a model and register it in a workspace.

value.title: Tune hyperparameters with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Choosing optimal hyperparameter values for model training can be difficult, and usually involved a great deal of trial and error. With Azure Machine Learning, you can leverage cloud-scale experiments to tune hyperparameters.

value.title: Develop typed functions by using TypeScript
value.excerpt: Learn how to develop typed functions by using TypeScript.

value.title: Upload your project by using GitHub best practices
value.excerpt: Learn to upload your existing project to GitHub.

value.title: Using IAAS support with Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: There are a variety of commonly used SAP-certified operating systems supported by SAP running on Azure VMs, and there are also several different methods of provisioning storage for SAP workloads in Azure. In this module, you will learn the SAP recommended support products and VM types as well as the network, database, and monitoring requirements.

value.title: Work with Data in Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Learn how to work with datastores and datasets in Azure Machine Learning.

value.title: Write Subqueries in T-SQL
value.excerpt: Write Subqueries in T-SQL

value.title: Deploy applications by using MSIX app attach for Windows Virtual Desktop
value.excerpt: Learn how to deliver applications using MSIX app attach technology. MSIX app attach is an application delivery technology that separates applications and their state from the operating system and assigns applications to users dynamically.

value.title: An overview of Azure Blueprints | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Alex Frankel (@sonofdiesel) joins Scott Hanselman (@shanselman) to discuss Azure Blueprints. Environment creation can be a long and error prone process. Azure Blueprints helps you deploy and update cloud environments in a repeatable manner using composable artifacts such as policies, role-based access

value.title: Azure Advisor – Your free, personalized guide to Azure best practices | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Jose Portugal joins Scott Hanselman to show how to use Azure Advisor to optimize your Azure workload usage, lower costs, increase efficiency, and improve security.  0:00 – Introduction 2:27 – Demo: Azure Advisor 6:30 – Demo: Alerts 7:06 – Demo: Recommendation digests 8:43 – Demo: Advisor Score 12:42

value.title: Azure Container Instances (ACI) under the hood | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Have you ever wondered what's going on under the hood for serverless offerings like Azure Container Instances? MacKenzie Olson shows Scott Hanselman the latest innovations in the infrastructure that powers ACI and a peek at the product roadmap, including a demo of the managed identity experience coming

value.title: Azure Event Hubs for Apache Kafka | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Shubha Vijayasarathy joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Event Hubs, which makes data ingestion simple, secure, and scalable. As a distributed streaming platform, Event Hubs enables you to stream your data from any source—storing and processing millions of events per second— so you can build dynamic
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/m3UEDhVYc-Q" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Apache Kafka on HDInsight
value.excerpt: Raghav Mohan joins Scott Hanselman to talk about Apache Kafka on HDInsight, which added the open-source distributed streaming platform last year to complete a scalable, big data streaming scenario on Azure. The service has come a long way since - processing millions of events/sec, petabytes of data/day
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gttwnNDHuZ4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Availability Zones
value.excerpt: Raj Ganapathy joins Scott Hanselman to discuss the new addition to Azure's resiliency offerings – Availability Zones. Azure Availability Zones are fault-isolated locations within an Azure region to help protect customers applications and data from datacenter-level failures with independent power, network,
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PP02QxplC2E" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Azure Backup
value.excerpt: Even though Azure takes three copies of your virtual machines and stores them in Azure Storage, you still need to protect your data against ransomware, corruption, or accidental deletion. Kelly Anderson stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman about how simple it is to set up Azure Backup, how its built-in
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HJeCqbbT-5s" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Azure Friday | Visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra shows Donovan Brown how you can now visually build pipelines for Azure Data Factory V2 and be more productive by getting pipelines up & running quickly without writing any code.  For more information, see:  ADF v2: Visual Tools enabled in public preview (blog) - https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/adf-v2-visual-tools-enabled-in-public-preview/

value.title: Azure HPC Cache - File caching for high-performance computing (HPC) | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Scott Jeschonek joins Scott Hanselman to talk about Azure HPC Cache. Whether you are rendering a movie scene, searching for variants in a genome, or running machine learning against a data set, HPC Cache can provide very low latency high throughput access to the required file data. Even more, your data

value.title: Azure Security Center | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Kelly Anderson joins Scott Hanselman to discuss Azure Security Center, which offers built-in security management and threat protection for your cloud workloads. Azure Security Center helps you find & fix vulnerabilities, aids in blocking malicious access and alerts you when your resources are under attack.

value.title: Bring compute, storage, and intelligence to the edge with Azure Stack Edge | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Dipti Pai joins Scott Hanselman to show how to run containerized and VM workloads to get quick, actionable insights at the edge—where data is created—using purpose-built hardware-as-a-service with Azure Stack Edge.  0:00 – Overview 0:55 – What is Azure Stack Edge? 4:09 – Azure Stack Edge in the house

value.title: Build real-time LiveOps into games with PlayFab | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Modern games require more powerful development tools, global and flexible multiplayer support, and new revenue models. PlayFab is a complete back-end platform for live games and a powerful way for independent studios to get started. Boost revenue, engagement, and retention—while cutting costs—with game

value.title: Code to Cloud with Docker and Azure Container Instances | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Chad Metcalf from Docker joins Scott Hanselman to show how to use the Docker CLI to deploy a container to Azure Container Instances (ACI). Using only the Docker CLI, Chad deploys a Minecraft image to ACI and then shares the public IP address with Scott so he can join in the wacky, blocky world!  ACI

value.excerpt: Aravind Krishna stops by to chat with Scott Hanselman and take a look at common design patterns for building highly scalable solutions with Azure Cosmos DB. value.title: Continuous integration and deployment using Azure Data Factory | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Gaurav Malhotra joins Scott Hanselman to discuss how you can follow industry-leading best practices to do continuous integration and deployment for your Extract Transform/Load (ETL) and Extract Load/Transform (ELT) workflows to multiple environments such as Dev, Test, Prod, and more. value.title: Deploy your Web App in Windows Containers on Azure App Service | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Windows Container support is available in preview in Azure App Service. By deploying applications via Windows Containers in Azure App Service you can install your dependencies inside the container, call APIs currently blocked by the Azure App Service sandbox and use the power of containers to migrate
